alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 3:27PM MST until August 24 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 830 PM MST. * At 327 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along Fortuna Wash. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yuma, Fortuna Foothills and Blaisdell. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 10 and 18...and near mile marker 9. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 31 and 38. This includes the following streams and drainages... Fortuna Wash and Gila River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
